39146339.review:
セールでかなりお得になっていたので思わず購入、
1話辺り3～４時間でクリアしました。
自分はパズルもHidden Objectを延々と探す系も苦手だったのですが、
このハンドルのゲームは クリックできる個所を表示してくれ、
どこを探せばいいかすぐにヒントを出してくれ、
本当に苦手なパズルはペナルティなしでスキップ可能と
もう実に手厚く介護してくれまして、とても 楽しくゲームできました。

ポイントクリックや児童書のような冒険譚が好きな人にお勧めします。
ただ、Eternal Journey　とStray Souls は虫がちょいちょい出てくるので、
「虫系全然ダメ」という人はご注意ください。

※ちなみに、1000 doorsの方は、House of Snark 6-in-1 Bundleにも
コレクターズエディション版が入っているようなので、
「被るの嫌だな」という人はご注意ください。

ゲームに出てくる背景画が本当にきれいで、
うっとりしながら見ていました。
全体的に非常に丁寧に作ってあってで感激しました。

なお、美術やシステムがよかった半面、ストーリーは・・

Eternal Journey以外は、パズルや探索要素に
冒険活劇の花を添えてくれる感じで
個人的は嫌いじゃなかったです。
(Dark Strokesは最初の船の絵見た時点で
最終ネタバレまでわかってしまいましたが・・)

ただ、終わり方がすべてあっさりししすぎていて、
シンデレラで例えると、「ガラスの靴が合った！探していた人が
見つかりました！」でメニュー画面に戻る的な感じだったので、
一言でもいいので「その後、王子様と結婚して幸せに暮らしました」
みたいなエピローグがほしかったなと思いました。

Eternal Journeyは・・「これはないわ」といいますか・・
突拍子もない展開過ぎて、ポカーンとしているうちに終わりました。
舞台背景は嫌いじゃないんですが、この材料を使って、
なんでこう料理しちゃった感が・・
ただ、好意的なレビューもあるようなので、好みの問題かもしれません。

全体的にストーリーの整合性などを重視しないおおらかな人向けだと思います。

(以下ちょっとネタバレ)
Eternal JourneyのEDは、敵のボスが知的生命体とのことなので、
主人公が泳がされてるとかだったら面白いなと思いました。
餌がなくなったので、ちょっと人間に擬態して、
主人公に別の惑星に連れてってもらおうという・・
これなら主人公が無事だった理由とか唐突出てくる人物とかの
整合性が取れる気がします。お先真っ暗エンドになりますが。
(全部のサブ情報を見てないので、全然違う理由が説明されてるかもしれませんが)

39077839.review:
There are four separate games in this bundle, and they're all from the same company and quite similar. That said, they are also all quite different. The names of each were utterly forgettable to me, except that the Atlantis game has maybe 5% of its gameplay actually take place in Atlantis, and that's in the first 15 minutes of the game. The rest of the game actually takes place on a human colony built on Mars in the future.

Alright, so my play time is going to look funky on this one because I played one of them and watched the other 3 played live on stream with 2 other friends. Another friend and I took turns clicking and such, while we both tried solving the puzzles. It was pretty entertaining and fun that way. We used Discord with screen share and it was great. The puzzles are pretty enjoyable in all four games, for the most part. There were definitely some odd ones in each which I didn't think were great, but it's basically like you told a point and click adventure game, removed watching your playable character walk around to do things, and added some Where's Waldo and a couple of puzzle minigames.

This all worked well enough in 3 out of the 4 games. The storylines in all of them were generally just laughably bad. The vampire one (Sins of the Fathers), however, stands out as being awful, not only in the plot, but in the gameplay. The "hidden object" portion of that particular hidden object game (the Where's Waldo-esque) part is a little [i]too[/i] much like Where's Waldo, in my opinion. By that, I mean that the other games feel more like a fun search for objects, whereas the vampire one has poorer graphics, making it harder to spot needed items and to differntiate between certain items easily, and it rehashes the same piles of items about 4 times each. The other games typically have you search the same pile of stuff 3 times or less.

I understand why they have you search the same piles so many times, but I think 3 should have been the limit. 4 was going too far. Everything you're searching through is grayscale or and brown much of the time, so it's not attractive to even look at for lengths of time. In the other games in the bundle, there are more attractive items and colors in most of the piles of stuff you search.

The music is fine and  the voice acting is pretty bad in these games, and my friends and I typically talked over the voices, or made our own if there weren't any, simply doing deliberately goofy and poorly fitting voices for the characters. These games are mostly just visually attractive, with the positive reinforcement feeling of quickly getting items and solving puzzles, as if you're playing a traditional point and click game, but designed to give you your dopamine nonstop while sacrificing plot, voice acting, and other aspects for the gameplay. Other than the vampire one, the other 3 items definitely make this bundle worth getting, in my opinion, unless you don't like point and click adventure games at all.

39060250.review:
I got this game on a pretty big sale, and I'm glad I did. I'm not at all saying it's not worth the full price, because it totally is, but it feels like incredible value when it's on sale. The acting and storyline of all of them are pretty bad, but if you can look past that, the games are fairly fun. I wasn't a big fan of the New Atlantis game that's included in this bundle ONLY because it forces you to run around a lot, but if you use the map to teleport to areas, it's not as annoying. Honestly, out of all of the games I played in this so far, (I didn't play House of 1,000 Doors yet) the New Atlantis one is probably the best value with the most interesting story, even though it still has bad acting and plot holes. 

Overall a great buy, great value, and definitely pleases my inner puzzle solver and hidden object lover.

EDIT: I've now finished all of the games included in this bundle. They were all very fun with House of 1,000 Doors being my favourite one out of the bunch. The others follow closely.

35967231.review:
"Hidden Object Bundle 4 in 1" sind vier Wimmelbildspiele.

Spielt man WImmelbildspiele sollte man sich rasch von jeglicher Logik entsagen. Alles ist durch Schlösser oder Codes verschlossen, eine Paketschnur läßt sich natürlich nur mit einer Schere öffnen, das scharfe Messer in unserem Inventar geht natürlich gar nicht und nach erfolgreichem Absuchen eines Wimmelbildes und Auffinden von zahlreichen Gegenständen bekommen wir... einen Bindfaden, den wir eigentlich gar nicht gefunden haben. Diese Logikbefreiung ist allerdings genretypisch und läßt man sich darauf ein, können diese Games durchaus unterhaltsam sein. Teils sogar nicht trotz, sondern wegen der abstrusen Logik.

Die Gemeinsamkeit der vier Spiele: alle haben irgendwie mit magischen Dingen zu tun. Eins verschlägt uns wegen eines verfluchten Juwels an zahlreiche Schauplätze überall auf der Erde ("Haus der 1000 Türen: Das Juwel des Zarathustra", eins läßt uns gar Atlantis finden und verschlägt uns zudem in eine Science-Fiction Zukunft auf dem Mars ("Ewige Reise: Das neue Atlantis"). Oder unsere Braut wird entführt ("Dark Strokes: Die Sünden der Väter") oder ein böser Clown zeigt uns, was Horror bedeutet ("Stray Souls: Das Haus Der Puppen").

Teils sind die Wimmelbildspiele schon älter. Gemeinsam haben aber alle ein sehr solides Gameplay, bei dem alles funktioniert und Bugs nicht zu finden waren. Für das Genre haben wir es hier mit qualitativ überdurchschnittlichen Games zu tun, mit stimmungsvollen Settings, guter Zeichenqualität und teils richtig atmosphärisch starken Zwischensequenzen. Auch die deutsche Übersetzung (in dem Genre öfter ein Problem) ist sauber.

Wer das Genre mag findet hier vier richtig gute Vertreter in einem Bundle. 

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
7/10 Atmosphäre
7/10 Story
7/10 Grafik
7/10 Sound
7/10 Spielmechanik
8/10 Balancing
7/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Vier gewinnt.

[h1][b]7/10 Gesamtwertung

- House of 1000 Doors - najsłabsza gra w tym zestawieniu. Bohaterka włóczy się po okolicach Tybetu, Indii, Jerozolimy i Madagaskaru żeby później zagrać organowy recitalik na trąbach jerychońskich żeby uratować świat i takie tam.

- Dark Strokes - wariacja na temat nietypowych wcieleń Darth Nihilusa, które mają wiele wspólnego z zaginięciami bliskich osób głównego bohatera. 
- Stray Souls - sierociniec, dziwne miasteczko, klauni i poszukiwanie narzeczonego głównej bohaterki z bardzo uroczą szmacianą lalką, która przy pierwszym spotkaniu przyprawiła mnie o zawał.

Bundle'a w promocji jak najbardziej polecam.

33596660.review:
What a great bundle of games! Even at full price, these games are still only around $2.00 a piece, giving you plenty of value for your money. If you are a Hidden Object game aficionado, then this bundle is a MUST HAVE for your collection. 

As with all bundles some games were better than others, however; all of the titles in this bundle are worthy of owning, in my opinion. I will say that my favorite game in this bundle was [b] Eternal Journey: New Atlantis [/b] since it had quite a different plot than most hidden object games. The graphics were beautiful, the story made me feel as if I were in a science fiction movie, and there was a lot of thought put into the information that was given to you within the game. Overall, a very well thought out and executed game.

Do understand that most of these games are older HOG's, so 3 of them I was forced to play with the black bars at the side of the screen, but it really did not affect me in any way to be honest. 

The only other slightly negative thing I can say for this bundle, is that it DOES include a game which is available on Steam as a Collector's Edition copy, so if you already have [b] House of 1000 Doors: The Palm of Zoroaster [/b], then you are better off playing it in the individual copy, since this bundle does NOT contain the collector's edition. I had already played this game myself, so I bought the bundle strictly for the other 3 games.

So, to sum this up:  BUY THIS BUNDLE! If you are hesitant, or just not obsessed with HOG's, then buy it on sale; just make sure you buy it, you really can't go wrong.

33059815.review:
Хороший банддл из четырёх хороших игр в жанре поиска предметов. Все они очень похожи, и различаются в основном атмосферой и сюжетом.
По геймплею всё очень даже стандартно. Ходим по красивым локациям под приятную атмосферную музыку, выбираемся из разных неприятностей с помощью найденных предметов; открываем шкафики, шкатулки с необычными замками, в которые всегда надо вставить 1-7 уникальных частиц, и/или разгадываем головоломку средней сложности; разгребаем кучи хлама, оставленные кем-то, чтобы найти 1-2 полезных предмета, которые лежат на самом виду, оставляя позади другие потенциально полезные предметы и магически угадывая, что понадобится в дальнейшем. В общем, всё что мы любим и ценим в играх этого жанра :)
При этом повествование остаётся стройным и относительно динамичным, действия - логичными и реалистичными даже в магической обстановке, а диалоги и кат-сцены не затянуты, и их не чересчур много.
А ещё, что очень удивительно, даже при прохождении всех 4 игр почти подряд головоломки не приелись и не казались одинаковыми. Схожие задания, конечно же, были, но довольно редко и в разных играх, а обстановка и ситуация делали их ещё более разнообразными для восприятия.

Приятно было, что в каждой игре есть дневник, в который записываются все важные события и все найденные подсказки вроде кусочков шифра, рецептов снадобий, рисунков, схем и других ключей к дальнейшему продвижению.
Также очень помогает карта, в трёх играх из четырёх она также помогает быстро перемещаться и узнавать, в каких зонах ещё остались выполненные или не выполненные действия, что часто полезнее подсказок.

В играх на многих локациях есть предметы для поиска, не обязательные для сбора. В "Заблудших душах" и "Доме 1000 дверей" это волшебные предметы, меняющие свой внешний вид с некоторой периодичностью. В "Новой Атлантиде" это что-то вроде нео-техно-свитков (карты памяти, как их назвали в игре) с некоторой интересной информацией о мире игры. В "Сердце тьмы" я не припомню таких предметов. Так как достижений стима в бандле нет, сбор этих предметов представляет чисто спортивный интерес. Ну и в "Новой Атлантиде" просто интересно узнать немного больше о мире игры.


Начать прохождение я бы посоветовала с игры "Заблудшие души. Игрушка", это та, что с клоуном. Во-первых, она, похоже, самая старая из всех, и поэтому некоторе моменты, в основном в плане удобства, ещё отсуствуют, да и графика в кат-сценах похуже будет. Если проходить её первой, не будет столь заметного контраста, и это будет восприниматься получше.
А ещё это самая мрачная и даже жутковая игра в наборе. Всё заканчивается хорошо, но процесс игры нагоняет жути. Хотя, разумеется, настоящих ужасов жанр не предполагает.

"Дом 1000 дверей. Длань Заратустры" - это продолжение другой игры про дом 1000 дверей. На прохождение это не влияет, но в диалогах герои явно дают понять, что они знают больше вашего, и что там какая-то богатая предыстория. Вероятно, было бы чуточку интереснее, если играть зная эту предысторию, но и так хорошо. Эту игру я бы порекомендовала пройти второй.

Оставшиеся две игры, "Путь в бесконечность. Новая Атлантида" и "Сердце тьмы. Запретный город" я бы поставила рядом. Мне больше понравилась вторая, и я бы хотела закончить прохождение бандла на ней, а не начать, но у неё чуть более грустная концовка (хотя тут ещё с какой стороны посмотреть). Обе игры безусловно хороши, и отлично подойдут на роль достойного завершения.

31520897.review:
Genialny zestaw gier :D
1. Zbłąkane dusze
Gra ma niesamowitą historię, ciekawych bohaterów, muzykę która dopasowuje się do tego co aktualnie się dzieje i ten klimat. Kilka razy o mało zawału nie dostałam podczas gry co jest niewątpliwie wielką zaletą tego HOPA. Podobały mi się różnorodne zagadki, przepiękne tła do HO oraz dubbing. Polska lokalizacja jest super - żadnych błędów nie widziałam.

2. Mroczne historie
Gra równie wspaniała co poprzednia. A historia chwilami łapie za serce. Z błędów znalazłam tylko jeden gdy w HO nazwano kraba rakiem :P

3.Niekończąca się podróż
Musze przyznać że grało mi się w nią całkiem przyjemnie. Fabularnie nieco naciągane, jednak mimo wszystko dołożono wiele wysiłku by zbudować świat (opis marsjańskiej technologii, badań naukowców). To naprawdę robi wrażenie i klimat. Muszę nawet przyznać że w jednym momencie gry się przestraszyłam. Aż żałowałam że twórcy nie wprowadzili więcej takich straszaków. Przyznaje że część zagadek jest strasznie łatwych, ale przynajmniej są różnorodne ;) Muzyka miejscami jest denerwująca, ale przez większość czasu umila grę. Jest jednak cos czego przeboleć nie mogę – polska lokalizacja. Miejscami jest nie tylko denerwująca ale i wprowadza w błąd. Dam kilka przykładów: kierujesz kobietą, jednak non stop jest „zrobiłem” itd. (naprawdę tak trudno odmieniać przez osoby?), kot pojawiający się w grze raz jest Marcy a raz Maurycym (ma rozdwojenie jaźnie czy jak?) no i mój ulubieniec: przedmiot nazwany „klamka do drzwi” a który jest korbą :P Jednak mimo wszystko polecam tą grę każdemu miłośnikowi HOPA.

4.Dom tysiąca drzwi
Zdecydowanie najsłabsza z gier w tym pakiecie. Zacznę od plusów: jest sporo róźnych zagadek (niektóre łatwiejsze, niektóre trudniejsze), odwiedzamy wiele unilaknych lokacji które oddają charakter państwa w którym jesteśmy (Madagaskar, Tybet), a w HO są ruchome elementy (otwórz/przesuń skrzynię by widzieć inne przedmioty). Muzyka też daje radę. Animacja jest miejscami dziwna i pokraczna, ale nie ukrywajmy - nie po to się kupuje te gry :D Problemem jest fabuła. Jeśli nie grałeś w poprzednią część to nie licz że intro ci coś wyjaśni. Nie zrobi tego. Historia jest taka na siłę i w sumie po zakoczeniu nie mam pojęcia jaki był cel naszych zadań i co łączy Gabriela z osobami które spotykamy. Chcecie wiedzieć z czym walczyślimy całą grę? buhahaha! Guzik kropka - nie ma szans bo twórcy całkowicie to olali i nie wyjaśnili. To tak jaby mieli 4 mini HOPA, postanowili połączyć to w jedno i na siłę wymyślali jak to zrobić. Na początku wszyscy dają nam do zrozumienia że znamy Gabriela, że spotkaliśmy go już. A pod koniec przygody wyskakuje jak filip z konpoii i się nam przedstawia o.o Szkoda, bo gra miała potencjał.

- Сердце Тьмы: Запретный город

Конкретно про каждую расписывать не буду, ибо они схожи и одинаково хороши, однако разнятся сюжетами и локациями. Скажу разве что про "Заблудшие души", которые являются самом старой игрой бандла. Игра откровенно проигрывает остальным товарищам в картинке и звуковом сопровождении.
Так же в каждой игре присутствует 2 уровня сложности - казуальный и экспертный. В первом быстрее восполняются подсказки и подсвечиваются активные зоны, в экспертном же глаза и думалку придётся напрячь побольше.
Видеовставки сделаны качественно, хотя и не претендуют на звание "синематиков". Во всех локализациях звуковая дорожка оригинальная английская, переведён только текст (мне это по душе, ибо так или иначе во время просмотра ваш английский растёт, а субтитры не дают потерять нить повествования).
Бандл определенно заслуживает места в библиотеке в подразделе "квесты".

22985878.review:
I'm going to group the games together for their mechanics until the end of the review because they're very similar/the same. You have all the classic types of puzzles in here: memory games, spin-and-match, etc. For the most part, they don't seem to be very challenging but are time consuming. They're still fun (besides a few puzzle types I don't really care for in any game), but you may hit "Skip" on a few just to keep moving.

The graphics are pretty decent -- mostly standard fare for HOGs. Don't expect excellent quality, however, as most HOG companies focus more on puzzles and story than graphics. Some computer animations will look like circa 2000s technology, but that never really bothered me. The voice acting was pretty decent for the most part, but there were a few characters who made me cringe a little.

House of 1000 Doors:
~I enjoyed the different settings you go through and the different themes. The story was okay but the ending was obviously cut off. You're promised an explanation and then the credits roll. The end. I've read that there's a collector's edition of this game that has the real ending and a few bonus levels. I was shocked that Alawar would do such a thing, but I guess they can do whatever they want with their games.

Eternal Journey:
~I played this one last because I didn't think I'd like it and I was totally wrong. This particular game was my favorite of the four and is easily in my top five favorite HOGs. I've never considered myself big on sci-fi so when I found myself really getting into the story, I was surprised. I wouldn't call it realistic sci-fi but I wouldn't call most HOGs realistic either. Even if you're not big into this particular genre, give it a shot.

Dark Strokes:
~Yes, I giggled at the title for a few minutes. Yes, I cringed at one particular voice actor who just couldn't act anyway but bored. Yes, I spotted the ending halfway through. I didn't hate the game but it was my least favorite. I don't normally harp on about a poor plot, but this one was legitimately bad. Every time something happened, I spotted a plot hole that could've been fixed with a little tweaking. I don't want to spell out spoilers, so I'll say don't bother unless you don't really care about that stuff.

Stray Souls:
~This one was weird. I really liked the dark atmosphere and design, but the story was so strange. The heroine, too, was very gullible to...everything. She liked to just accept things at face value with little coercing or argument, even when a desperate person would go, "Wait, what? No way." The "twist" about the bad guy was so obvious I wouldn't even call it a twist. I enjoyed enough things in this one that it's not the worst of the bundle, so it sits above Dark Strokes (teehee) and below House of 1000 Doors.

22033987.review:
A bundle of 4 HOGs containing:

House of 1000 Doors: The Palm of Zoroaster
Nice graphics, the HOGs scenes are beautiful but the difficulty is very low. 46 morphing objects to find. The story is fantasy style, with magic and fire spells and a very classic construction. Also it's a sequel and I didn't play the previous game(s?) so it felt a bit awkward. The characters and the cutscenes are nice. The ending was a total let down though: the cutscene lasted 3 seconds! It's the game I liked the least in the bundle but it's still a good game and I do recommend it.

Eternal Journey: New Atlantis
You're an archeologist exploring an underwater city, then end up exploring the future. This one is more original than the usual run of the mill: you'll dive underwater, repair solar panels, use space suits etc. There's also 18 collectibles to find and the map is very handy. The graphics and the music are nice and the future is clichéd but well done. The mini games are very good. I liked it a lot. The best game in the bundle IMO, the most innovative and the Sci-Fi setting is pretty rare within HOGs.

Stray Souls: A Dollhouse Story
Creepy and so well done that I've already replayed it a second time. There's a lot of good ideas in this one, like a live doll clone of Number Nine, a creepy doll house, with creepy dolls, a creepy little boy and 36 morph objects to collect! If you like horror theme then you'll surely like it. The only con is the res that seems lower than the other games, so the image is a bit blurry. The second best game in the bundle IMHO.

Dark Strokes: Sins of the Fathers
I had already played that one previously but I enjoyed replaying it. Graphics and characters are gorgeous, music is okay. Didn't like the mini games much, tedious and not original at all. The HOG scenes offer a bit of challenge, being dark and cluttered. Again there's a boat model and you find little dolls to fill it but it only unlocks videos, no small featurettes with the dolls like in Stray Souls. The videos you unlock are rather bland. And no special collectibles to find. A dark setting but all in all it's rather classic. But I liked how the story unfolded and how the player is guided toward the next scenes. Third best game in the bundle.

Conclusion: all the games are good and you won't be deceived! Each game lasted 4 hours (5 for a leisure playthrough) so it makes this bundle really worthy.

21904713.review:
After the 5 in 1 bundle, Alawar released anoth batch of hidden objects, though this time, they released only three new games on Steam. Indeed, House of 1000 Doors: The Palm of Zoroaster was already released as a Collector's Edition. It means that for anyone already owning it, it's not a complete surprise. However, for the rest, it's a nice addition.

[b]House of 1000 Doors: The Palm of Zoroaster[/b]

Kate Reed is called back to the House of 1000 Doors: a gem spread a plague in it and every resident, particulary Gabriel, is in a grave danger...

You understand, this game is the second in a series of four (the first is also on Steam) but you don't need to play the previous one to understand the universe.

While the game is pretty standard in terms of gameplay, what's great in that game is the universe itself: you're travelling between different worlds, through the house. And this time, you'll learn more about Gabriel, the guardian of the house. The graphics are very good too, which is pleasant.

For more information, read this review: http://steamcommunity.com/id/vicrabb/recommended/302120

[b]Eternal Journey: New Atlantis[/b]

After an accident, you're waking up into the future, thanks to new technologies and because your knowledge was important. You don't know what happened to your fiancé, making you sad about your new life. Sent to a mission in space, you're crashing into a planet... How will you manage to save yourself? And will you discovered what happened to a previous crew of the base?

When the game is showing clearly a sci-fi adventure in space, you don't understand why you're beginning in the present, with an underwater experience. However, given the twist at the beginning of the story, I feel like this part could have been avoided. However, the rest of the game is very faithful to the sci-fi theme. You're arriving into an abandoned base and your journey will be full of dangers, though at the end, a familiar face will appear. The gameplay isn't innovative as it's the same as any other hidden games.

In other words, you search for items, you use them, you clear hidden objects scenes and you solve puzzles. Everything is pretty easy. You can search also memory cards, explaining about the future. And with all the video cards around, you can also know more about life on New Atlantis and the secrets hidden there.

However, what I loved with this game is the graphics, very sci-fi, with some sounds making me think about Doom.

Anyway, it's my favorite among the three (I don't count House of 1000 Doors, as it's already a favorite of mine) new hidden objects in this bundle. If anything, I wouldn't mind to see this one as a collector's edition.

[b]Dark Strokes: Sins of the Fathers[/b]

Ethan and Clair are visiting the young man's father but she's kidnapped by The Faceless One. Ethan, decided to save her from them, is making his way into a decimated city. However, all the kidnapped persons are tied to a tragedy and the death of a boy on a boat... 

The game is also a good one: the plot is really well-written and I didn't realize the truth before nearing the end. While it's shocking to discover who the Faceless Ones are, the title make a reference to Ethan's father and to the boy's one. The graphics are also good, as you're navigating through a city that is diving into darkness progressively. The gameplay is still the standard one: hidden objects to find, puzzles to solve, etc..

[b]Stray Souls: A Dollhouse Story[/b]

Your husband is in danger and you need to save him. However, the town seems to be the home of a terrible spirit and the orphanage may be the key to stop it...

Stray Souls has an interesting plot: your husband being the "damsel" in distress, a young sad boy, a sad clown and a mysterious woman, everything related to your man's past. Besides, what's good is that you have a little companion: a doll that can talk and can help you to discover the truth behind everything. Besides, the concept of cleansing some rooms of the evil is very nice as you can discover new items in them.

However, the gameplay is still the same as any other hidden object game: find items, use them, clear hidden objects scenes and solve very easy puzzles. The hidden objects scenes are kinda reminiscent of the early era: with objects being in the same tone of color as the background or with a very small size.

The graphics are what I like generally: a town plunged in darkness, with everything around making you understand that evil is watching you. However, I wished that perhaps, the locations were a little more original than the mandatory cemetery or police station.

The soundtrack was also good.

I enjoyed the game, that's a fact but I feel like something is missing. I don't know, maybe more interactions for the doll?

Anyway, this is also a good pick for the bundle.

[b]Conclusion[/b]

This bundle is way more worthy than the 5 in 1. I can't judge for the 6 in 1 as it's a new release and that I'm in the first game. Anyway, for the price, it's a very enjoyable experience, as I wasn't disappointed in any of the three games that I discovered. And as I was already convinced by House of 1000 Doors, I can easily recommend this bundle, more than the previous one. Every game has good graphics, good sountrack, a gameplay, while being standard, polished without too much brain frying.

Any lover of HOG can buy this bundle and any person wanting to discover the genre can too, as there are no "weak" games like in the 5 in 1. Go ahead!

21633623.review:
[i]Hidden Object Bundle 4 in 1[/i] is a collection of four fun games for a bargain value, three of which are not available on Steam outside of this bundle. This is a great collection to pick for fans of this genre.

[b]Dark Strokes: Sins of the Fathers[/b]

The first game in the bundle that I played was [i]Dark Strokes: Sins of the Fathers[/i], I was attracted to the title’s name and the preliminary artwork of the protagonist Ethan and his fiance Claire. The story starts off with the two of them being summoned by Ethan’s father to come visit, simple enough. Though, as soon as Ethan utters the words “Everything will be fine” players are thrust into a world of supernatural mystery and family secrets. Claire soon finds herself kidnapped, shock, and Ethan must save her from the clutches of a mad man. 

The game itself plays like a basic hidden object game. Finding items in a variety of different scenes with puzzles and mini games thrown in. One feature I enjoyed was that you could find more than one useful object at a time during the hidden object scenes. So instead of having to replay a scene countless times you could say pick up the knife and puzzle piece needed in one go through. Artwork was lovely in the game and the audio was good as well, voice acting was a bit on the cheesy side though but that added to the charm.

[b]Eternal Journey: New Atlantis[/b]

I next jumped into [i]Eternal Journey: New Atlantis[/i] again, based off the title. I was expecting a mystical journey through the lost city of Atlantis, instead what I got was a space odyssey. The story starts off with Amrite, a famous archaeologist, going to explore the newly discovered ruins of a temple from the fabled city of Atlantis. However, tragedy strikes as the excavation site is destroyed taking all mortals with it. Fast forward over a century later, Amrite is on her way to a Martian archaeological site to lend her expertise. After being suspended in cryogenic sleep, it’s time for her to use her skills to help mankind find a new home as they flee Earth.

The game’s story is rather far-fetched but refreshing as Amrite wanders around a deserted space station with only a kitten as company. While I wouldn’t look for deep inner monologue or reflections of the emptiness of space itself, the game does present a very good mystery element as you try to figure out what happened to the crew. The artwork is alright, I feel it’s a bit weaker than the other titles in the bundle but not bad at all, it certainly feels other worldly along with the music. The game also has voice acting which is a plus, and it’s not bad either. The game plays smoothly but be prepared for quite a bit of backtracking, thankfully there is a map.

[b]Stray Souls: A Dollhouse Story[/b]

In my opinion the weakest of the four titles, I played this one last because it had a creepy clown in it. You play a woman named Danielle who has just witnessed her husband Sam being kidnapped. A talking pin cushion doll instructs you that you must return to the town that Sam grew up in to find him. As is the case with many protagonists in these games, Danielle shows the minimal amount of shock at her current situations and rushes to find Sam. The story is weird, involving magic, orphans and clowns. The story is also slightly predictable, many twists being obvious before they happen. The biggest example being the clown, never trust a clown people.

What the game lacks in a compelling story and interesting characters it makes up with good gameplay and artwork. The artwork matches the setting of the story, it’s dark and moody along with the music. The visuals draw players in and the puzzles and hidden object scenes keep them there. Tasks move from one to another smoothly and it’s usually easy to figure out your next step, the game also isn’t too difficult either which can make it a little short. I wasn’t even prepared for the sudden ending of the game as things seemed to wrap up very quickly despite the slower pace of the rest of the story, though I found the ending to be one of the better parts of the entire game.

[b]House of 1,000 Doors: The Palm of Zoroaster[/b]

I saved this one for for last because it’s the only one of the four games available on Steam separately. The difference being that the separate version is the collector’s edition which has bonus content as well as a bonus chapter for more gameplay. I played the game again to see if there were any other differences between the two but there are not. The issue with this game is the story, you play Kate who is returning to the House of 1,000 Doors for really no reason, she isn’t summoned and she never outright states why she’s going back after her adventures in the first game of the series, also available separately on Steam. Once you arrived you’re sucked into supernatural escapades. The story offers no real sense of urgency, however, as you try to stop a mysterious fireball you only find out is the Palm of Zoroaster at the end of the game. The unfortunate part is that the bonus chapter, not available in this bundle, adds more story than the main game offers.

The game is still fun, however. It is hidden object scene heavy with a few puzzles as well. The artwork is good and the game has a great map feature which makes the backtracking less tedious. [i]House of 1,000 Doors: The Palm of Zoroaster[/i] is filled with lovely artwork as well and rich scenes from different areas of the world. The only real technically issue I had with the game was the voice acting, it was very wooden and sometimes pretty bad, especially the main character Kate. This is a minor issue, though, in an overall pretty solid game and nice addition to the bundle but I would certainly recommend buying this and [i]House of 1,000 Doors: Family Secrets[/i] on Steam separately.

Отличная подборка игр, все разные, но интересные. У подборки только два недостатка: первый - несмотря на то, что игр здесь четыре, считается это одной игрой, соответственно комплект коллекционных карточек один и нет достижений. Второй - это версии игр без бонусных глав. Последний пункт немного расстроил, люблю бонусные главы.
1. Дом 1000 дверей. Длань Заратустры - продолжение первой части. Играла в эту игру до покупки бандла, и считаю, что ее все же стоит приобрести отдельно. Она не такая классная, как первая часть, но все равно увлекательная и стоит внимания. Здесь бонусная глава была бы очень важна - ведь она раскрывает не предысторию, а продолжение.
2. Путь в бесконечность. Новая Атлантида - пожалуй, лучшая игра из подборки. Научная фантастика, оригинальный сюжет (в кои-то веки главная героиня не ищет любимого, а просто исследует станцию!), интересные локации, красивые ролики, правильно работающая логика поиска. Очень понравилась игра.
3. Сердце тьмы. Запретный город - красивый стимпанк, немного банальный сюжет, но в целом приятное впечатление от игры. Особой интриги нет, но игра сделана хорошо. Сцен поиска предметов на мой вкус многовато.
4. Заблудшие души. Игрушка - самая слабая из четырех игр, на мой взгляд. Судя по всему, самая старая. Обычный сюжет поиска любимого в странном городе, слишком много сцен поиска, причем не очень хорошо нарисованных, странные диалоги, ужасная логика поиска предметов. Самый большой плюс игры - иногда бывает страшно, всякие ползающие по экрану мухи и внезапные силуэты.
В целом, все вместе стоит своих денег, особенно на распродаже. Не хватает только бонусных глав.

This must be the best value on Steam for lovers of hidden-object games. The games are all somewhat old (some only support lower resolutions), but they are some of the best of the genre. Strongly recommended!

[b]House of 1000 Doors: The Palm of Zoroaster[/b]. (I played this as a standalone Steam game.) A good hidden-object game, and a very nice, improved sequel to Family Secrets! Taken together, they can be considered one of the better games in the genre. It is quite long and interesting, with a very well-balanced difficulty level, and a wide variety of delightful settings. The voice acting (in English) is horrid, but it doesn't much diminish the overall effect.

[b]Eternal Journey: New Atlantis[/b]. Another superb classic, with an epic, imaginative storyline and fun hidden-object scenes.

[b]Dark Strokes: Sins of the Fathers[/b]. A superb, classic hidden-object game, with lush graphics and animation, good hidden-object scenes, and a handful of decent puzzles. The story is a cliché, but the excellent presentation makes up for it.

[b]Stray Souls: Dollhouse Story[/b]. Spooky, delightfully directed story, excellent graphics, and many superb hidden-object scenes. What more can you ask for? A HOG masterpiece.

18768443.review:
This is a decent bundle of four Hidden object games. Fun and challenging if you like those types of games. Consisting of a storyline with side mini-games and several avenues of searches to complete puzzles and goals. As is standard with hidden object games, it consists of a lot of rooms or areas with several objects to collect, as well as puzzles and gadgets that you need to find parts for to activate or build so you can move to another level, room or location.  Search areas may be inside structures, outside, in walls and through alleys. The artwork looks nice with great background sound effects, some background annimations and music. If you stop playing,  it auto saves to the point that you left the game, so you will start back where you left off. I say this, because I could not find a users option to manual save, or a quick save option in the menu at the time I started playing.

 Now if you like this type of game, Enjoy playing for fun, and is satisfied with Steam giving you some playing cards on the game,  I believe you will like this bundle. If you are an achievement hunter on the other hand, and you only play games to secure as many achievemnts as you can or are a 100 percenter, then you may not like these games. At this time, they offer no achievements or badge other than the cards through steam. 

 I have played two of the games so far and now starting Eternal Journey : New Atlantis.  So far I have not run into any glitches or problems. I have seen where some people found glitchy areas or even had a problem with the games playing correctly after a bit of play. Now, as with any game that saves locations, maps, movements and start points, you should make sure your system has enough memory, and always do a disk cleanup from time to time. As I stated, so far, I've had no issues, glitches or hangups.

18638841.review:
Рекомендую сборник казуальных квестов, все 4-е игры весьма симпатичны:
1) В "Новой Атлантиде" предстоит исследовать марсинско-атлантские гробницы и наблюдать не плохую фантастическую историю.
2) "Заблудшие души" - классический казуальный ужастик, поиск предметов среди черепов и кукл вуду прилагается.
3) "Длань Заратустры" совмещает мистическую историю с локациями в стиле разных культур, от викингов до индии.
4) "Сердце тьмы" красивый квест, с красивыми локациями, персонажами и лирической историей про любовь, месть и потустороннее. Ищем юную невесту в загадочно-красивом городе и боремся с незнакомцами в масках.

18396177.review: This isn't new games. I'm guessing these are at least 5 years old. Still good games with rather easy/casual puzzles. Two of them got hidden/morphing items. For the price it's good value if you like hidden object games. Resolution is different for each game but none of them support full-hd. All in all this good value just don't expect new games.

18378614.review:
I will rate this package based on per game as I play through them. However for the price you can't go wrong with this bundle with 4 Hog games for one low price.

Eternal Journey - Good game with decent graphics, also a travel map with hints to what locations have stuff to do in them. Also good soundtrack and pretty good voice overs.

Dark Strokes-Sins of the Father- Decent graphics and the storyline is pretty good. I have played this game before and am enjoying it again years later. There is a map but no fast travel or hints to tell you where to go next.

House of 1000 Doors-The Palm of Zorcaster- I did not replay this one as I have it in my Steam library from a while ago ( I have the Collectors Edition which is still available on Steam). It is a great game with a good story line. I have always loved the House of 1000 Doors Games. Can't comment on map travel or location hints due to not replaying it. 

Stray Souls-Dollhouse Story- the graphics in this one are really outdated. It comes across on my widescreen as a bit pixelated but still playable. The story is interesting and again no map or location hints. 

Overall a good bundle for the price. However no achievements are available for any of the games adn none of them are Collector's editions with bonus content such as extra chapters.
